intro: Scrophularia humilis, commonly known as the lesser scrophularia, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters and features hairy stems and opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from pale pink to deep red, blooming from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The species is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a characteristic plant of moist meadows and woodland edges.
